sentences.sContent: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.sCn: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.sContent: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.sCn: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.sContent: He died of cancer last month.
a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.sCn: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

sentences.sContent: ...Recently it was shown that they could be trained to be as accurate as humans at detecting breast cancer in images...
...Our risk of cancer rises dramatically as we age...
...It's hard to uproot deeply held beliefs about cancer screening with scientific data...
...you are more than twice as likely to die of skin cancer than a woman...

remMethod.val: “看色” → 谈癌色变 → 癌症

trans.tranOther: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal
